thread.title: Newcastle 'must shatter' transfer record to sign striker and Gibbs valued at £8m - transfer gossip

author: Chris Waugh
title: Newcastle 'must shatter' transfer record to sign striker and Gibbs valued at £8m - transfer gossip
text:
Get Newcastle United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Newcastle United have been told they must shatter their 12-year-old transfer record if they hope to lure Villarreal striker Cedric Bakambu to Tyneside, according to reports. 
The 26-year-old Democratic Republic of Congo striker has scored 23 goals in 57 La Liga appearances over the past two seasons and West Ham United are believed to have already seen a £22million bid for Bakambu rejected this summer. 
A report in The Sunday People claims that, should Newcastle hope to sign the French-born forward, the Magpies will need to pay well in excess fo £22m. 
Given that United’s transfer record of £17m has stood for a dozen years - that was the fee Newcastle paid Real Madrid to sign Michael Owen back in 2005 - it will mean Mike Ashley will have to spend significantly more on a single acquisition than he has during his decade-long stint as Magpies owner. Read More Reported Newcastle target Cedric Bakambu is 'in no hurry to leave Villarreal' Cedric Bakambu (left) and Kieran Gibbs 
Rafa Benitez is certainly keen to bring in a forward this summer, having frustratingly missed out on signing Tammy Abraham on loan from Chelsea to Swansea City. 
Bakambu’s pedigree suggests he would be worth considering - the forward has five goals in 13 international appearances for DR Congo, while he has netted 34 goals in 81 games in all competitions for Villarreal - though Burnley’s Andre Gray also remains on United’s watchlist. Read More How the 'Brexit effect' on sterling means Florian Lejeune will cost £1.2m more than a year ago 
Meanwhile, the same Sunday publication also claims Newcastle-linked left-back Kieran Gibbs will be allowed to leave Arsenal for just £8m this summer. 
Reports last month suggested the Gunners wanted closer to £15m for the 27-year-old England international but, given that Gibbs has just 12 months left on his contract, Arsenal may be prepared to settle for around half that amount. 
Gibbs himself is also reportedly seeking £70,000 a week from any potential suitors. Read More
